com.joliciel.talismane.sentenceDetector

Interface SentenceDetector


  • public interface SentenceDetector
    Detect sentence boundaries within a textual block. The linefeed character will always be considered to be a sentence boundary. Therefore, filters prior to the sentence detector should remove any arbitrary linefeeds, and insert linefeeds instead of any other patterns indicating a sentence boundary (e.g. XML tags).
    Author:
    Assaf Urieli

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Pattern POSSIBLE_BOUNDARIES
      A list of possible sentence-end boundaries.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTokenFilter(TokenFilter filter) 
      List<Integer> detectSentences(String prevText, String text, String moreText)
      Detect sentences within a particular textual block, given the previous and next textual blocks.
      List<TokenFilter> getTokenFilters()
      Token filters mark certain portions of the raw text as entire tokens - a sentence break will never be detected inside such a token.

    • Field Detail

      • POSSIBLE_BOUNDARIES

        static final Pattern POSSIBLE_BOUNDARIES
        A list of possible sentence-end boundaries.

    • Method Detail

      • detectSentences

        List<Integer> detectSentences(String prevText,
                            String text,
                            String moreText)
        Detect sentences within a particular textual block, given the previous and next textual blocks.
        Parameters:
        prevText - the previous textual block
        text - the current textual block
        moreText - the following textual block
        Returns:
        a List of integers marking the index of the last character in each sentence within the current textual block. The index is relative to the current block only (text), not the full context (prevText + text + nextText).

      • getTokenFilters

        List<TokenFilter> getTokenFilters()
        Token filters mark certain portions of the raw text as entire tokens - a sentence break will never be detected inside such a token.
        Returns:

      • addTokenFilter

        void addTokenFilter(TokenFilter filter)
